name: Hilton Colon Guayaquil

reviews.title: Bad Customer Service
reviews.text: I stayed here one night. I was sick with a flu. I checked in at midnight and at 12:30 a.m. I was woken up by my next door neighbor which had six men drinking beer and being very loud. I contacted the front desk THREE times to resolve the problem and they did nothing at all. I had no sleep that night, and they never offered to move me. Marco was the person at the front desk. The room was ok. They refused to give refund. Finally after contacting Hilton in the US, a compliant was filed. I talked with managment via email and they said they were going to refund me. It has been over a week and the refund has not posted. Becareful staying here. I reccomend the Radisson or even the Howard Johnson. They have EXCELLENT customer service and shuttle to airport.

reviews.title: very close to airport
reviews.text: The Hilton is less than 10 minutes from the airport. The service is good with attention to baggage details.
I enjoyed staying at this hotel. I had a nice room on the third floor (standard, not exective) that was very large and comfortable, good bed.
reviews.title: Nice rooms, good pool, good place ot stay

likes.liked: — Overall pleased, nothing at all to complain about, I liked getting a 1 pm check out (time was noon normally) with no hassle at all

reviews.text: Staff was good, always offering a greeting, helpful and proactive. I had no problems. All were very good.
reviews.title: Nothing special

reviews.text: Breakfast was extensive and good. Pool is very nice and pool bar very good service.
reviews.title: Unfortunately we had to stay there twice!

reviews.text: Busy hotel, popular with locals. I very much liked it and would return and recommend it again. I have to say I liked Guayaquil more than I expected, it is worthwhile for a weekend.
reviews.title: Really Good.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the second time we have stayed at the Hilton Colon and really it is nothing special. The food is mediocre, the service is bad in the restaurant and the rooms are OK. I can say the pool is very nice and comfortable and the service next to the pool was very good. The location is near the Mall del sol and it was easy to get a taxi to take us anywhere in Guayaquil. Overall I expected more from a Hilton hotel.
reviews.title: Great restaurants, very comfortable and large rooms

reviews.text: Claims to be 5-star but lacks the attention to detail that genuinely defines that category. No bath slippers in room, washing materials not replaced as a matter of course, a coffee/tea machine available but costs $2 per day to use. And strangely, the sauna in the health spa lacks a drinking water machine (although there is a free Listerine dispenser!), so remember to take a bottle with you to avoid total dehydration.
reviews.title: Not quite there

reviews.text: On the other hand the internet connection worked reasonably well, although it took a while to get going. And the buffet breakfast is filling if not exactly refined.
reviews.title: An oasis

reviews.text: The Hotel Colon has the feel of a 4 * western style hotel. We stayed here twice on our trip. The hotel is loaded with tourists both pre and post Galapagos. This is where the high end tour groups stay. It is about 5 minutes from the airport.
reviews.title: Did the trick

reviews.text: The rooms are large by western standards, the bathrooms marble and glass. The beds are comfortable. The TVs have all the ususal cable channels. Decent business center. The spa, and gym are almost like a resort. But the best part was the huge warm pool. A welcome oasis after a week on a small boat.
reviews.title: great stay for us
Hold on to your valuables!
reviews.text: The food at the buffet was just average but the Grill restaurant was very nice; well presented cuts of meat, decent wine list. We were too chicken to try the sushi place.

reviews.title: Nickled and Dimed by pompous management
reviews.text: Won't waste anymore money here, spent 10 days and lots of money. Had guests at the pool and was asked to pay $8 for each non-swimming guest. I ordered food and drink for all and still was asked to pay a services charge. The pool was empty. I was embarassed in front of our guests by the manager. I told him that I have spent thousands on every stay each year at Hilton and HH honors, he could care less. This Hotel is a premium hotel and they act like it. I checked out early and went to the HoJo's next to the mall del sol. It is more gringo friendly, You can walk to the mall via a pedestrian walk, casino, lot more things to do safely than being stuck at the hilton. I have been to Ecuador 6 times, my wife is Ecuadorian, Four points is good also. Forget Oro Verde thats downtown.

This is, without a doubt, the best hotel in Guayaquil. It is located in the new business zone, ave. Francisco de Orellana (5 min to the airport, 5 USD). Although Guayaquil is relatively large (about 3 million), all the attractions of the city are in a relatively small area. Probably, you will never have to be more than 20 minutes in a cab.
reviews.title: Best in town

reviews.text: Rooms are large and nicely decorated (beds are very comfortable). The hotel security is OK, and the staff is very friendly and speaks good english. The food of the cafeteria (Cafe Colon) is normally mediocre, but the Sushi place is great.
reviews.title: Loved the Guayaquil Hilton Hotel, is the best in town
Guayaquil is a wonderful place to visit anytime

reviews.text: The high-tech meeting room at this hotel boasts chairs designed to be comfortable for eight-hour business meetings, but the Hilton has a lot more going for it than comfortable seating and an ATM machine that spits out U.S. dollars.
reviews.title: We enjoyed the service and the hotel ***** 5 stars

description: Conveniently located in Ecuador, a strategic point of South America, just few minutes from the international airport, Hilton Colon Guayaquil provides relaxing experiences for business and leisure guests alike.Our fully renovated hotel offers comfort, world class dining, elegance, hospitality, detailed service and lot more.
